fields.name: Pauline Kanana
fields.bio:
Kanana is an experienced design and strategy lead and a seasoned trainer and mentor in the design innovation space, who is passionate about young people in Africa.

 

She leverages multi-disciplinary design strategies and tools as a catalyst for innovation in academia, private and public sectors and local and global organizations to promote impact-driven and community-led solutions that lead to positively long-lasting social, economic and environmental development locally and globally.

 

Kanana co-founded and directed Nairobi Design Institute (NDI), the first design innovation school in the region that fostered design talent based on human-centered design practices to create innovative and effective user experiences that address Africa’s biggest challenges. She is also a design lead at Proportion Global and SpaceAI.

fields.name: Munyala Mwalo
fields.bio:
Munyala is an experienced Strategic designer with a keen interest in the application of Human centered and behavioral design for Social Impact.

 

He has spent the last 6 years applying design-led processes to help organizations overcome the barriers of innovation, facilitating the adoption of a beginner’s mindset in problem solving and behavioral strategies in creating and testing impactful interventions for social change.

 

Being a creative and an amazing listener, he understands the role of experimentation, empathy & facilitation of collaborative processes in crafting complex problems and designing sustainable and impactful solutions.

fields.name: Ramah Madiba
fields.bio:
Ramah is a highly experienced technical lead with over 10 years of experience in the industry. In his previous role as a Senior Network Planning Engineer, Ramah demonstrated his technical expertise in network planning and optimization.

 

He has a deep understanding of network infrastructure and is skilled in designing and implementing complex networks that meet business requirements. Ramah's experience in network planning and optimization, coupled with his strategic design background and user-centered approach, make him a well-rounded technical lead with a broad range of skills and expertise.

 

He is adept at leading cross-functional teams and managing projects from concept to delivery, ensuring that products and services are optimized for success.

fields.name: Sarah Mpapuluu
fields.bio:
Sarah is passionate about people, social change and innovation. She is keen on working on projects where she engages in research and designing with communities and end-users of design. She has over four years of experience conducting research and design projects across the African continent.

 

At ThinkPlace she worked on various projects engaging with people from vulnerable and challenging or hard to reach contexts across Africa. She has also engaged in capacity building projects to train young men and women in the continent on design thinking skills.

 

With a professional background in Development studies and knowledge of behavioral design, she can identify key behavioral traits for understanding people and provide insights to build interventions that influence context-friendly outputs in programming work.

fields.name: Denise Wendy
fields.bio:
With a passion that goes beyond statistics, Denise is a multidimensional accountant and administrative maestro. As a key component of the IDI Africa team and success, she thrives at assuring financial accuracy and effectiveness due to her background in taxation and accounting.

 

Overseeing administrative tasks and making sure everything goes as planned is what she enjoys doing best. Volunteering for charities is her most passionate endeavor since she invests in helping others have meaningful experiences and lives.

 

She leads and takes part in a variety of philanthropic activities, which demonstrates her compassionate and communal values.

fields.title: Mombasa Plastics Prize
fields.content:
Website: mombasaplasticsprize.challenges.org

Design Challange

To encourage innovation and awareness amongst aspiring entrepreneurs and leaders (ages 18-25) in Mombasa County through the Mombasa Plastics Prize challenge by Challenge Works, by inspiring the development of solutions that tackle the problem of plastic waste mismanagement within informal settlements.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What we did

 

  • Contextual research with youths and local stakeholders to inform the design and validation of the challenge prize

  • Program design of a 5-month innovation challenge prize

  • Innovation support from problem-framing to validating viable business ideas through financial and non-financial capacities

  • Program design of a 6-month incubator program to transform 9 high potential innovations into viable businesses.

  •  Designing impact evaluation strategies and tools

     

Outputs

fields.title: E4Impact Accelerator
fields.content:
Design Challange

Designing and delivering a comprehensive capacity-building program for  tech-entrepreneurs  to empower their companies with the skills and knowledge to overcome challenges and transform their pain points into viable business ideas. 

What we did

  • Design thinking research sprints for challenge identification and problem reframing

  • Development of innovation-led business plans for better value-offerings through 

  • Product iteration through product design workshops to improve their competitiveness

  • Supporting in pitch preparation for fundraising

Outputs

fields.title: ï»¿Founders Factory Africa Academy
fields.content:
Design Challange

Developing an entrepreneurship program for aspiring entrepreneurs to identify and frame challenges, develop ideas and create businesses that are investable.

What we did

  • Needs assessment to identify entrepreneurial gaps and opportunities

  • Designing of a 6-week innovation program

  • Innovation support from problem-framing to validating viable business ideas through financial and non-financial capacities

  • Designing impact evaluation strategies and tools

Outputs
